comment: He was extremely nice and caring. You have 5 tests, the lowest gets dropped + extra credit. His lectures are straightforward. He'll teach how to do the subject, and the rest of the class are examples of it. Honestly, this was an easy class to begin with. The final was HORRENDOUS though.

I really liked how the class was taught and structured. Most of class time is solely dedicated to solving and understanding problems from the text which allows students who miss classes to keep up. The grading format for 5 tests + final seemed fair to me and you still have opportunities to earn credit in class.

Mesbahi's grading scale was based on only 3 grades that mattered. However, the final replaces the lowest (and potentially all lower) test grades if you do better on it. His test problems came straight from the textbook, and his class emphasized problem-solving instead of useless theory. He definitely was one of the best professors I've had.

Professor Mesbahi is a ok professor. His class is lecture heavy and starts teaching during the first week. If you do the HWs and put in the effort, it's easy to pass. His lectures weren't very interesting and I had to study everything again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment:
THE GOOD NEWS: The lectures last 10 minutes, the rest of the class is working very conversational examples.
THE BAD NEWS: The class is graded by 5 exams, with the lowest dropped, no partial credit. Homework is optional and not graded or even looked at. There is no leniency for test absences; if you miss an exam, that is your dropped grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Mesbahi has been one of my favorite professors. He makes sure you get the material and explains things using practical examples. If you want to learn Statics, take him.

Professor Mesbahi is one of the best professors that i have ever had the opportunity to have. He has a very dry sense of humor but is very funny once you talk to him more. He not only is a very good professor but is also very well known in the community. I cant recommend taking him and developing a good relationship enough.

Took this class Spring 2021, asynchronous online. Has no graded homeworks or quizzes, only 4 tests with the option of taking the final exam. Material is algebra based! His video lectures were hard to watch, and he didn't post much material himself. The SI sessions are the only reasons I passed this class. Jeff Hansen on YouTube is your friend.

3 exams made up our entire grade, he gave us our overall grade before the final and if we were happy with it we could accept that as our final letter grade instead of taking the final exam. He works through problems every lecture and explains them well. As long as you take good notes, study, and understand the material you will pass.

His class is very straight forward. However, if you're not invested or you're not good studying by yourself don't take him. There is only 3 tests and a final. Partial credit is given but he is probably the toughest grading teacher I've ever had. Pretty much had to study lonesome and I put in at least 20 hours of studying for a test and didn't pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: COVID era rating: He's a pretty straightforward prof. He gives "HW" that isn't graded, but is essential the study guide for the test. His uploaded lectures are absolute garbage quality, but his class is easy. No web blocked browser or camera required. Do and understand the HW and youll do great on the test.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great for statics he uses class time to work through the problems you need to learn and will answer questions you have. The entire way he teaches is based off of you practicing the material so you know it and can reproduce on tests. He gives a total of 4 through the semester and they're each 6 questions. theyre exactly the same as the ones in class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: One of my favorite teachers. He'll make you learn the subject and does a decent job of teaching it. Extremely knowledgeable and will help you. Participate in his class and he will like you. Talk while he's teaching and he'll put you on blast. He's lowkey the GOAT when it comes to project cost. Definitely recommend.

He breaks everything down to it's simplest concept. Ask questions. He does example problems the whole class period, which I found to be great. Homework is suggested. If you try to do all the homework after each class you will make an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is a great a professor. I took him for statics and Project Cost Analysis. Attendance is not mandatory, no quizzes, no homeworks. He assign hw problems, but just for you to get ready for the test. Tests are pretty straightforward. He challenges students to work out problems. Group project was not so hard for Project Cost

This guy was very good at working out examples and making sure everyone understood the problems. The test questions were pretty fair as he usually would work out an example like it in class. The only grades in this class is the test. His classes usually have the highest average on the final.
Difficult Class and the tests are very hard. He doesn't really explain the class very well. Do the homework assigned and you'll pass

group project sucked, but i was the guy that didnt do anything. I got an A presenting it to him. only do the first 4-5 problems of HWs and the tests are SUPER easy if you read the problem literally. One of the easiest classes ive taken

Awful. 5 tests of three questions each... Every test had something on it that was not gone over in lecture or homework. Material is not hard. Just when you study what was supposed to be studied, and something different shows up on the test, it's really frustrating. I KNOW the material that was assigned and I got a D in the class. Do. Not. Take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 2214. Teaches from a practical "real world" view. Class environment is loose and sometimes with him walking around and answering questions and giving feedback while students tackled a particular problem. Be prepared and ask questions . If he gives handouts do them. Most test were 3 questions so not much room for error. Would definitely take again.

He is straight forward, and if you can do the homework, you can pass his tests. Tests were really easy, and the group project took a lot of time, but was clear cut as to what to do. If you get a good group, you will have an easy class for the semester.

The kind of class where you will either make an A or completely fail. 5 tests that are 3 questions so if you miss one thats it for you. Theres also a final but its similar to the tests. Only good thing was no attendance but dont take him.

Several students dropped out of his class, and I'm regretting that I didn't too. He is a really tough grader, and he offered extra credit too little too late. The homework is optional, but I wish it would have & been assigned  graded so I could make a better grade. I would not recommend this professor. It was one of the worst classes I've taken.

Pros:  -Very straight forward and easy to under-stand material.   Cons:  -Very tough grader, says he gives partial credit, but I never got any. -If you are confused you better find a tutor because he won't be very helpful.

Grade absolutely is not indicative of one's knowledge of the subject. 2 group projects but only graded part is you presenting to him with whatever questions he asks you for 2 seconds in his office. Very unclear. Favorite quote when asked a question is Google it or look in your Means Book. 2 very hard tests over ENG ECON make up 70% of the grade

He is not very clear as far as teaching... his grading is just as bad. He graded me as average on the rubric, and with a curve the test was a 68. He is the only one who teaches project cost, so good luck.

This guy is a jerk. Every time I asked a question in class he told me to look it up in the book. Even worse so, he once said at the end of class that we were free to leave unless we had any questions. I asked him a question. He looks at me and says "think about it", and literally walks out of the classroom. Totally disrespectful. Avoid this prof.

I really liked this class and the professor does know a lot about the subject. He uses real world examples ad explains very clearly. You have to work for your grade and he will try his best to answer any question you have. He will go over the homework just as long as you have completed it. No complaints, but definitely get the book!
